results.headline: Review: ‘The Witness,’ a Brother’s Quest to Put Kitty Genovese Case to Rest
results.summary_short: James Solomon’s documentary traces Bill Genovese’s efforts to unravel his sister’s 1964 murder, a Queens case long seen as the epitome of urban apathy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Witness

results.headline: Review: In ‘Me Before You,’ a Broken Man Meets a Free Spirit
results.summary_short: This floppy British romance, directed by Thea Sharrock and adapted by Jojo Moyes from her best-selling novel, stars Emilia Clarke and Sam Claflin.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Me Before You

results.headline: Review: In ‘Andron,’ Deadly Games With Alec Baldwin and Danny Glover
results.summary_short: A knockoff of “The Hunger Games” and “The Maze Runner,” this film adds up to less than the sum of its parts.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Andron

results.headline: Review: In ‘Approaching the Unknown,’ Mark Strong Trades Earth for Mars
results.summary_short: This Mark Elijah Rosenberg film centers on an astronaut and has echoes of movies like “2001: A Space Odyssey” and “Interstellar.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Approaching the Unknown

results.headline: Review: ‘The God Cells’ Advocates Fetal Tissue Therapy Without Debate
results.summary_short: A company that markets stem cell therapy cooperated with the filmmaker on this one-sided documentary focusing on treatment success stories.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The God Cells

results.headline: Review: ‘Gurukulam’ Offers Sights and Sounds of a Spiritual Awakening
results.summary_short: This documentary follows students and their teacher, Swami Dayananda Saraswati, as they explore the Hindu philosophy of oneness in a forest ashram in India.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gurukulam

results.headline: Review: ‘The President,’ a Sweeping Tale Inspired by the Arab Spring
results.summary_short: A dictator and his grandson, on the run during a political revolution, hide incognito among the citizenry in this film from Mohsen Makhmalbaf.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The President

results.display_title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
results.headline: Review: With the Latest ‘Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles,’ an Existential Crisis
results.summary_short: In “Out of the Shadows” the superheros contend with an apocalyptic villain and wonder what it means to be normal.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows

results.headline: Review: Andy Samberg Spoofs Pop Stars Without Spite. And That’s 4 Real.
results.summary_short: The Lonely Island trio has created a mockumentary featuring the fictional Conner4Real, a former boy-band star trying to make it as a solo act.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping

results.headline: Review: When Auschwitz Inmates Reunite in ‘To Life,’ the Shadow of War Remains
results.summary_short: This Jean-Jacques Zilbermann film focuses on postwar revelations and the friendship three women forged when prisoners in the camp.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of To Life

results.headline: Review: In ‘Princess,’ an Israeli Family in Need of Boundaries
results.summary_short: In her first feature, Ms. Shalom-Ezer explores the shadowy territory between family love and illicit sex.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Princess

results.display_title: Jia Zhangke, a Guy From Fenyang
results.headline: Review: ‘Jia Zhangke, a Guy From Fenyang,’ a Portrait of a Visionary Filmmaker
results.summary_short: The documentary is a decent and conscientious companion piece to Mr. Zhangke’s films.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jia Zhangke, a Guy From Fenyang

results.headline: Review: ‘Presenting Princess Shaw,’ a YouTube Star in the Making
results.summary_short: This documentary portrays an aspiring singer from New Orleans who posts performance videos of herself and longs for recognition, which arrives almost magically.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Presenting Princess Shaw

results.headline: Review: ‘The Ones Below,’ Looming Parenthood and Unsettling Suspense
results.summary_short: For two couples sharing a London townhouse, the joys of expecting take a dark turn in this thriller, the feature debut of David Farr.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Ones Below

results.headline: Review: ‘Holy Hell,’ Inside a Cult, via Its Own Videographer
results.summary_short: A member pursues and documents a cult leader whose persona devolves from charismatic to creepy in this documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Holy Hell

results.display_title: As I AM: The Life and Time$ of DJ AM
results.headline: Review: ‘As I AM’ Explores DJ AM’s Rise and Decline
results.summary_short: This documentary serves up the cautionary tale of a genre-defying D.J.’s rise in a high-flying pop world and his ultimate undoing in a drug overdose.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of As I AM: The Life and Time$ of DJ AM

results.headline: Review: In ‘Chevalier,’ the Manly Games Played on the Aegean
results.summary_short: This comedy by the Greek director Athina Rachel Tsangari follows six men on a yacht as they compete against each other for a golden ring.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chevalier

results.headline: Review: ‘The Idol,’ the Underdog Story of an ‘Arab Idol’
results.summary_short: Hany Abu-Assad’s film expands on the story of Mohammed Assaf, a Palestinian pop singer who won “Arab Idol” in 2013.

results.headline: Review: ‘X-Men: Apocalypse,’ a Sequel 5,000 Years in the Making
results.summary_short: Directed by Bryan Singer, this latest addition to the blockbuster franchise pits the superhero team against a mutant villain from ancient Egypt.

results.headline: Review: ‘Alice Through the Looking Glass’ and a Trippy Time Machine
results.summary_short: This sequel to Tim Burton’s “Alice in Wonderland,” directed by James Bobin, offers a world of grotesque overabundance cluttered with special-effects gadgetry.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Alice Through the Looking Glass
